subclass.name: Crazed Architect
subclassFeatures: Boon of the Raven Spirit|Warlock|DRK|Composite Armaments|HEC|6

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Supreme Mind
entries: You realise that you have a guest residing inside you. Whether your will is your own or the creature's is unclear because it seems that they have merged together completely. As you ascertain yourself as a being of one mind and two bodies in a symbiosis, your abilities seem to reflect your change. As you gain levels in this class, your control over your mutation increases and you will be able to pioneer a path that has never been explored before.

subclassFeature.name: Awakening
entries: {@i 3rd-level Psionics feature}

You can now communicate telepathically with one creature within 60 ft of you at a time and they can respond back to you telepathically. The creature must not be hostile to you and must understand atleast one language. You also understand and can communicate in Deep Speech.

As part of the bonus action when you enter rage and as a bonus action while raging you can attempt to grapple a creature. If a creature is moved forcibly while being {@condition grappled} by you, you can also move to keep grappling the creature. The amount of movement used up in such a way cannot exceed your total movement speed and is reduced from the distance you can move on your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Transmogrification
entries: {@i 6th-level Psionics feature}

When attempting to grapple, you can do so telekinetically as translucent tentacles visible only to you and the target creature, wraps around the target creature. The maximum range for the telekinetic grapple extends to within 10 ft of you or upto the reach of your melee weapon, if it is higher. You also get to choose the focus of your path from the two options listed below. You can choose a different option each time you get to choose a new focus.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Path
entries: You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts or determine whether you are lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it. You gain resistance to psychic dmg.

subclassFeature.name: Body Path
entries: When a creature is {@condition grappled} and as a bonus action while it is {@condition grappled}, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or take psychic dmg equal to one roll of your wrath die + Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: {@i 10th-level Psionics feature}

You have immunity to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions while your Rage is active and you have advantage against such effects while not raging. When a {@condition grappled} creature deals damage to you or breaks free from your grapple, you can immediately use your reaction and a wrath charge to attack the target creature and on a hit, you add the number rolled on the wrath die to the damage dealt. You also get to choose the focus of your path from the two options listed below. You can choose a different option each time you get to choose a new focus.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Path
entries: Whenever you take more than 10 damage while raging, you can deal psychic dmg to the {@condition grappled} creature equal to three rolls of your wrath die.

subclassFeature.name: Body Path
entries: When you are grappling a creature and you use the reckless attack feature, the {@condition grappled} creature must roll a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) and on a failure, it is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. This effect is dispelled from the {@condition grappled} creature if your rage ends or if it is not {@condition grappled} by you anymore.

subclassFeature.name: Transcendent Causatum
entries: {@i 14th-level Psionics feature}

When attempting to grapple a creature telekinetically, a translucent illithid form of you appears instead of tentacles to grapple the target, and is visible only to you and the target creature. Your illithid form is one size larger than you and grows or shrinks to maintain the size difference if your size changes. When you successfully grapple a creature or start your turn while grappling a creature, you gain one charge of wrath. You also get to choose the focus of your path from the two options listed below. You can now change any of your selected focuses to another one during a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Path
entries: A {@condition grappled} creature using magical effects, spells or any feature that helps it end the {@condition grappled} condition on itself without using an action to make a contested ability check as normal, must succeed on a Wisdom ability check against your Strength ability check to be able to use those features. You have advantage on this Strength ability check if you are raging. You can spend one minute concentrating on a {@condition restrained} or {@condition incapacitated} creature and it is {@condition charmed} by you at the end of that duration. The {@condition charmed} condition lasts for 24 hrs and you can telepathically communicate with it during this time, if it is on the same plane of existence as you. You can only have one creature {@condition charmed} at a time from this feature and if the {@condition charmed} condition ends on the creature, you become aware of it.

subclassFeature.name: Body Path
entries: When you take damage while grappling a creature, you can expend your reaction and all your wrath charges to halve the damage you take and redirect the other half to the {@condition grappled} creature as psychic damage. You also deal additional psychic damage equal to the wrath die expended when using this feature. You can only use this feature once every short rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Raven Queen
entries: Your patron is the Raven Queen, a mysterious being who rules the Shadowfell from a palace of ice deep within that dread realm. The Raven Queen watches over the world, anticipating each creature's death and ensuring that it meets its end at the proscribed time and place. Warlocks sworn to the Raven Queen receive visions and whispers from her in their dreams, sending them on quests and warning them of impending dangers.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Raven Queen lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Sentinel's Vigilance
entries: {@i 1st-level Raven Queen feature}

Starting at 1st level, the Raven Queen grants you a Raven spirit that watches over you. A spectral raven only you or a creature with truesight can see, appears perched on your shoulders. It cannot be targeted by any spell or attack and cannot take any damage. It grants you advantage on death saving throws and bonus to Perception checks equal to your Charisma modifier.

You can send your raven spirit to protect those on the border of life and death. As a bonus action on your turn or as a reaction when a creature rolls a death saving throw while within 30 ft of you, you stabilize the dying creature and grant it the effects of the {@spell Sanctuary} spell. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Boon of the Raven Spirit
entries: {@i 6th-level Raven Queen feature}

Starting at 6th level, the raven spirit empowers your mind and the modicum of power granted to you by your patron. You gain immunity to the {@condition frightened} condition. In addition, your chosen pact boon is improved as shown below.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: Your familiar gains a bonus to it's hit point maximum equal to twice your warlock level and it's proficiency bonus scales with your proficiency bonus. While your familiar is alive, you and your familiar get advantage on ability checks using skills for which the both of you share proficiency. Your familiar can now share the same initiative as you and take it's turn during your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: Your pact weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage when it hits. When you create your pact weapon or at the start of your turn(no action required), you can change the damage type of your pact weapon to necrotic or cold. Additionally when you hit a creature, you can choose to have it make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save dc and on a failure, it is {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn. You can do so for a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: When you perform the ritual to receive an amulet, you receive a number of amulets equal to half your proficiency bonus(rounded up). The number of uses on the features provided by these talismans to their wearers are shared by all the talismans, but they recharge on a short rest instead of a long rest. When a talisman wearer uses one of it's features, they get temporary hitpoints equal to your warlock level.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: When you deal necrotic or cold damage through spells, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage dealt and you can do so only once per turn. During a long rest, you can prepare a number of spells equal to your proficiency bonus from the spell list of any class, for which you have spell slots for, and these spells are considered as warlock spells for you. The spells prepared in such a way do not count towards the number of spells known by you.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of the Ravens
entries: {@i 10th-level Raven Queen feature}
The Raven spirit granted to you has influenced your physique, over the course of it's companionship. You gain resistance to cold and necrotic damage.

As a bonus action, you can manifest spectral raven wings that give you magical flight with flying speed equal to your movement speed for one minute. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

As an action, you can assume the appearance and statistics of a {@creature raven}, except for your dexterity and mental scores. You can use an action to revert back to yourself. In this form, you gain a bonus to Stealth checks equal to your Charisma modifier and a flying speed equal to 100 ft. You can't cast any spells, but you can concentrate on spells while in this form.

While in this form, you are vulnerable to all damage and the damage you take cannot be reduced in any way, including resistances. Any damage taken in this form is carried over and reduced from your hitpoints. If you were flying while you take damage, then you lose the form immediately and start falling, unless you have a way to prevent it. However, you only take half of the fall damage in this situation.

subclassFeature.name: Queen's Eminent
entries: {@i 14th-level Raven Queen feature}

You get blessed by the Raven Queen herself for your service that has been matched by few. You can choose to replace your 6th and 7th level Mystic Arcanum with a spell of the same level from the Wizard spell list. Your pact boons are improved and as a bonus action you can now channel your Raven spirit to supercharge your pact boon for one minute, as described below. The effect remains until you end it as an action, the duration ends, or you fall unconcious. You can use this feature once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: Your familiar passively gains a bonus to it's ac and saving throws equal to half you Charisma modifier(rounded up). Any spell you cast that targets only you can also target the familiar. Once per turn, while delivering a touch range spell using it's reaction, it can deal extra necrotic damage or heal the target creature for an amount equal to your Charisma modifier.

For one minute, your familiar starts exuding a soothing aura or a sinister aura for upto 20 ft. You can choose the aura as part of the bonus action used to activate this ability and your familiar can use a bonus action on it's turn to change the aura.

When your familiar exudes a soothing aura, any allied creature in the aura regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing. It also gains the ability to use it's action to grant itself and one allied creature within the aura, temporary hitpoints equal to your warlock level. The allied creature can instead choose to gain advantage in one attack roll, ability check or saving throw until the end of it's next turn.

When your familiar exudes a sinister aura, any hostile creature in the aura takes {@dice 1d6} extra cold damage when it is hit by an attack. When your familiar attacks a hostile creature in the aura, it can do so with your spell attack and damage modifier instead of it's own attack and damage modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: Your pact weapon deals a critical when you roll 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20} for the attack roll and once per turn, you take the maximum possible result on all damage die when you hit a creature with your pact weapon. For one minute, you enter a state of frenzy and you become unable to cast spells for the same duration. You can now attack three times whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

While in the state of frenzy, when you take damage that reduces you to 0 hit points and doesn't kill you outright, you do not fall {@condition unconscious} until your next turn is over and you remain at 0 hitpoints. Taking damage in this state causes death saving throw failures as normal and three failures can still kill you.

On your subsequent turn, you can only take the {@action Attack} action to make attacks with your pact weapon and at the end of your turn, you heal for half the highest damage dealt by you in a single attack in this turn. If you remain at 0 hitpoints after this turn ends, you fall {@condition unconscious}. This feature can be used only once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: When any of the wearers regain hitpoints by any means, all of the wearers regain hitpoints equal to your Charisma modifier. The creature that gains temporary health from using a feature of the talisman, adds your Charisma modifier when calculating the total temporary health it receives.

For one minute, each talisman wearer can choose to be resistant to one type of damage of their choice at the start of their turn (no action required). For the same duration, all talisman wearers take the maximum possible result on dice rolls when using any of the features granted by the talisman.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your spells ignore resistance to cold and necrotic damage, and treat immunity to cold and necrotic damage as resistance to cold and necrotic damage. For one minute, when you roll damage for your spells that deal cold or necrotic damage, you can reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier(minimum of one).

Once during this one minute duration when you deal necrotic or cold damage using a spell, you take the maximum possible result on all damage dice. If you reduce any creature to zero hitpoints while using this feature to deal maximum damage with your spell, you regain the use of this feature. You can regain the use of this feature only once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Crazed Architect
entries: Your patron is the Crazed Architect, a being who severed itself from reality in it's obsession to make the most technologically advanced weapons. Now it reaches out from it's workshop to mortals and shares with them a fraction of it's works to test their performance. Pactmakers that show promise might even be blessed with some of it's knowledge and access to it's workshop.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Crazed Architect lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Crazed Architect Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell hail of thorns}, {@spell gift of alacrity|DRK}

subclassFeature.name: Tools for the Job
entries: {@i 1st-level Composite Armaments feature}

Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency in firearms and tinker's tools. If you already have proficiency in tinker's tools, you can get proficiency in another artisan tool of your choice. Any checks made with tools you are proficient in and checks regarding firearms gain a bonus equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: The Crazed Architect's Accord
entries: {@i 1st-level Composite Armaments feature}

Your patron grants you an unique trinket. When attuned to the trinket, it magically reshapes itself into any form valid for a trinket that you desire(no action required). It can only be attuned to by a warlock of your patron and while attuned it does not take up an attunement slot of the creature attuned to it. While attuned to the trinket you cannot use any weapon that has the firearm property.

While attuned to the trinket you can have it consume a nonmagical firearm, or a magical firearm that is not attuned to any creature. The statistics of the firearm that you feed is stored in the trinket and as an action, you can have your trinket take the form of any of the firearms whose data is stored in it. You can only wield a firearm as a weapon when it is a form of your trinket

As an action, you can also have it change back to it's trinket form. When you use the trinket to replicate the statistics of a firearm and wield it as a weapon, it grants you the following benefits: You ignore the misfire chance of any weapon whose form your trinket replicates and you can use the trinket as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells in all of it's forms.

subclassFeature.name: Synchronicity
entries: {@i 1st-level Composite Armaments feature}

Whenever you make an attack with your trinket in a firearm form, you gain a stack of 'Synchronicity'. You can have a maximum of three stacks and you lose one stack of 'Synchronicity' when you end a turn without attacking with your trinket in it's firearm form. You gain the following benefits based on the number of 'Synchronicity' stacks you have:
1 - Your movement speed increases by 10 ft.
2 - Attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
3 - Once until the start of your next turn, you can prevent one of your rolls from being affected with disadvantage.
{@i 6th-level Composite Armaments feature}

subclassFeature.name: Zero Energy Loss
entries: {@i 10th-level Composite Armaments feature}

When you expend a Warlock spell slot, your trinket gains a 'ZEL' charge. Your trinket can have a maximum amount of 'ZEL' charges equal to the maximum amount of Warlock spell slots you have according to your Warlock level. Your trinket retains the charges until you take a short or long rest, at which point it resets to zero charges. You can use the charges to use some special shot options, as listed:
{@i 14th-level Composite Armaments feature}
